title: Aces ride 'twisty, windy' road back to WNBA Finals
content: A'ja Wilson scored 35 points and Jackie Young had 32 to lead the Aces back to the WNBA Finals as Las Vegas held off pesky Indiana in the deciding Game 5.

title: Mitchell exits with cramping as Fever's run ends
content: Fever star Kelsey Mitchell left Tuesday's Game 5 loss to the Aces in the third quarter because of lower-body cramping.

title: Crochet retires 17 straight as Red Sox swipe G1
content: Boston ace Garrett Crochet pitched into the eighth inning on Tuesday night, at one point retiring 17 consecutive batters, in a sparkling pitching performance that sent the visiting Red Sox past the New York Yankees 3-1 in their AL Wild Card Series opener.

title: Boone defends pulling Fried as Yanks fumble lead
content: Yankees manager Aaron Boone's in-game decisions were under the microscope yet again after his bullpen failed to protect a 1-0 lead in a 3-1 loss to the Red Sox in Game 1.

title: WNBA players back Collier in ripping league
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: Agent: Hill's surgery went well, WR to play in '26
content: Tyreek Hill will not need another surgery after undergoing a major procedure Tuesday to repair his dislocated left knee and multiple torn ligaments, agent Drew Rosenhaus told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Saleh rues 'wrong choice of words' in Coen spat
content: San Francisco 49ers defensive coordinator Robert Saleh told reporters on Tuesday that he "could have found a better choice of words" during his argument with Jacksonville coach Liam Coen on Sunday, following the Jaguars' 26-21 victory at Levi's Stadium.

title: Kuminga, Warriors end stalemate with 2-year deal
content: Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors ended a monthslong stalemate Tuesday, reaching agreement on a two-year deal worth $48.5 million.

title: 📈 NFL Power Rankings: Biggest offensive issues
content: We stacked every NFL team ahead of Week 5. Who jumped up our 1-32 list? Plus, let's pick out the biggest offensive concerns for each roster.

title: WNBA Finals first look: How the Aces and Mercury match up
content: Las Vegas hosts Phoenix on Friday to open the WNBA Finals. The team whose big three plays the best will win the title.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: The 12 teams currently in and the four on the cusp
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: 'There is a personal side of it all:' How NFL QBs and refs approach their in-game chats
content: Aaron Rodgers is 'humorous.' Patrick Mahomes wants to be informed. Here's what QBs and refs say about their conversations.

title: Mourinho reception at Stamford Bridge shows how far Maresca needs to go with Chelsea
content: Maresca's Chelsea beat Mourinho's Benfica in the Champions League, but the reception from fans made it clear which manager is revered.

title: As Pogba nears return, Man City's Monaco visit offers glimpse of what might've been
content: Three years ago, Man City wanted to take Paul Pogba. Instead, he returned to Juve, where his career unraveled.

title: Here's who our experts pick to win every round of the 2025 MLB playoffs
content: Which will be the last team standing in October? Our MLB experts predict which teams will win each series of the postseason.

title: 'Dana White's Contender Series': Four fighters win by finish to earn UFC contracts in Week 8
content: "Dana White's Contender Series" continues to prove it's a fruitful path to fighting in the UFC. Find out which fighters can earn a contract this week.

title: What went wrong and what needs to happen next for the U.S. Ryder Cup team
content: Who should be the next captain for Team USA? How can Scottie Scheffler turn around his Ryder Cup record? We answer some of the biggest questions facing the U.S. ahead of 2027.

title: How Europe backed up Rory McIlroy's words and won the Ryder Cup on the road
content: Two years ago in Rome, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Europe's gutsy team play made it come true.

title: How one city’s tragedy birthed a standard for a championship years in the making
content: For 30 years, the Oklahoma City bombing -- the most devastating act of homegrown terrorism in history -- has been seared into the identity of the city. Since 2008, the Thunder have been trying to honor it -- and give the fans a new one.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Kuminga's $48.5 million deal with Warriors
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Why Karim López looms as Mexico's first NBA star
content: The Sonora teenager is poised to become the first Mexican-born player to be drafted in the NBA's first round, a feat that would lift his local celebrity to unlimited heights.

title: Oregon in OT? Bama's redemption? Ranking the 25 best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: Winners and losers of Kirill Kaprizov's NHL record-setting contract
content: Here's how Connor McDavid, Mikko Rantanen, Kyle Connor and others should feel after the winger's new pact.

title: Post-Ducks crashout, how Trevor Zegras can recapture the 'magic' with the Flyers
content: The cover athlete from EA Sports' NHL 23 hit a wall in Anaheim, but gets a reset after a trade to Philly.

title: Pickups: Replacing Malik Nabers, surprising RB options
content: Highlighting available free agent options after a weekend of surprising performances ahead of Week 5.

title: Hamilton's love for Roscoe made F1 superhero relatable, human
content: Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton is nothing short of a superhero, but his relationship with bulldog Roscoe made him feel like one of us.

title: Is the original Bloodline's return imminent?
content: Roman Reigns joined The Usos at Raw. It was his first time in a WWE ring since being stretchered off at Clash of Paris in August.

title: 'Don't you talk s--- about Steven Seagal': MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: WNBA coaching tracker for 2026: Wings part with Chris Koclanes
content: The WNBA coaching carousel starts with openings at Dallas, Seattle and New York, plus new teams Portland and Toronto.

title: Revisiting every big transfer from this summer: Should our expectations be dialed back?
content: This summer had its share of blockbuster moves, but how have they panned out so far? Do we need to scale back our expectations of these players -- or expect even more?

title: Ruben Amorim running out of excuses: The numbers don't lie
content: Soccer management is ultimately a numbers game, and none of them are adding up for Man United's manager.

title: College football betting: Buckeyes, Ducks the favorites for national title, Heisman
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet them.

title:
NFL Week 5 betting lines: Chiefs are MNF road favorites in
 Jacksonville
content: Chiefs are favored for Monday Night Football, Lions are the biggest road favorite of the Week 5 NFL slate

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool and Man United could vie for Carlos Baleba
content: Liverpool and Manchester United could go head to head over Brighton's Carlos Baleba. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Andrew Nembhard, Brandon Miller among top middle-round targets
content: Building a championship-caliber roster means finding solid contributors after the early rounds of your draft. Here are eight to focus on.

title: NCRB data: When crime numbers hide more than they reveal - decoded
content: Delhi is the country's crime capital with 1508.9 IPC cases per lakh population, while Jharkhand reports the fewest. However, Jharkhand's murder rate is significantly higher than Delhi's and Kerala's, suggesting widespread under-reporting of other crimes. This disparity highlights better policing and rigorous crime reporting in states like Delhi and Kerala.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: Encounter in Bareilly; 2 men of Tauqeer Raza held
content: UP Police arrested two associates of cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan following an encounter in Fatehganj Paschimi. The accused, Mohd Idris and Iqbal, had allegedly snatched a constable's anti-riot firearm and fired at police during a September 26 clash. Police recovered the stolen gun and other weapons, vowing continued action against those inciting unrest in Bareilly.

title: First since 2019: US govt shuts down – Why it’s more serious this time
content: The US government has entered its first shutdown since 2019, fueled by a bitter healthcare funding clash between President Trump and Democrats. Unlike previous standoffs, the administration is threatening permanent federal job cuts to reshape the workforce, sparking widespread anger.

title: Gill hints at playing extra seamer in Ahmedabad; shares update on Bumrah
content: Team India captain Shubman Gill has hinted at playing an extra seamer in Ahmedabad’s first Test against West Indies, citing overcast conditions. He described the quick turnaround from the Asia Cup as a mental challenge and warned West Indies of “tough cricket.” Gill emphasized the importance of wickets offering opportunities for both batters and bowlers.

title: Diwali cheer for central govt staff! 3% DA, DR hike likely to be approved - Full details
content: Central government employees and pensioners are likely to receive a 3% hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) and Dearness Relief (DR), with Cabinet approval anticipated soon. This biannual revision, aimed at offsetting inflation, will increase the DA/DR rate to 58%.

title: Sridhar Vembu: There is lot of false information going around about Zoho
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu addressed public misconceptions on social media, clarifying that all products are developed in India and Indian customer data is hosted domestically. He emphasized Zoho's use of its own infrastructure, not major cloud providers for data storage, and affirmed the company's political neutrality and lack of government funding.

title: Kharge hospitalised: Son says planned pacemaker implant procedure; 83-yr-old leader stable
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge was admitted to MS Ramaiah Hospital in Bengaluru for a planned pacemaker implantation and is reported stable. The 83-year-old leader, who was earlier hospitalized for fever, is scheduled to address a public rally in Kohima, Nagaland, on October 7, focusing on youth employment and good governance.

title: 'Tariffs to hit growth': RBI on impact of Trump trade war; confident of India’s resilience
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra warned that US tariffs pose risks to India's economic growth, potentially decelerating it from late 2025. Despite this, the economy remains resilient, bolstered by domestic factors and GST reforms. The central bank, however, kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%

title: US govt shutdown: Musk points to key issue; demands free healthcare for illegal aliens
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in six years due to a funding deadlock. Democrats' push for ACA tax credit extensions is a key sticking point, which Republicans claim benefits "illegal immigrants." Elon Musk has amplified these Republican claims, while non-essential services cease and essential workers face delayed pay.

title: Boost for Tejas fleet: HAL receives 4th GE engine; $1 bn follow-on order likely in Oct
content: GE Aerospace delivered the fourth F404-IN20 engine to HAL for India's Tejas Mk1A. HAL confirmed negotiations concluded for a follow-on order of 113 F404 engines, valued over $1 billion, expected to be signed in October. This deal, alongside F414 tech transfer talks, significantly boosts India's defence indigenisation efforts.

title: Hyd actor Dimple Hayathi booked: Allegedly harassed domestic help; clothes torn, phone smashed
content: Film Nagar police registered a case against Telugu actress Dimple Hayathi and her husband, David, for allegedly harassing their 22-year-old domestic help. The complainant reported repeated abuse, denial of food, and threats. David reportedly smashed her mobile phone when she attempted to record their abusive behavior, leading to charges under various BNS sections.

title: 'If you make…'- Ex-India cricketer gives huge warning ahead of Test series
content: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra advised against preparing rank turner pitches for the upcoming Test series against West Indies, warning they could be counterproductive by reducing the competitive gap. He advocated for balanced surfaces that allow matches to progress naturally over four to five days, noting how extreme pitches have negatively impacted senior Indian batsmen's confidence and performance.

title: Accenture lays off thousands: CEO says we are 'exiting' employees
content: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.

title: Internationalisation of Rupees: RBI announces slew measures - All you need to know
content: The Reserve Bank of India has announced significant measures to elevate the rupee's global role, permitting cross-border lending in INR to Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, and expanding the use of Special Rupee Vostro Accounts. These initiatives aim to lessen US dollar dependence, supported by India's strong economic fundamentals, including a moderated current account deficit and robust forex reserves.

title: Neck-deep water, no fear: Flooded Mathura underpass poses danger; cop rescues family trapped in car
content: Relentless rainfall paralyzed Mathura, causing widespread waterlogging and exposing civic lapses. A traffic policeman, Kuldeep Malik, bravely rescued a family from a submerged car under a railway bridge. This incident sparked admiration for the officer but also criticism of the city's unpreparedness and failed drainage system.

title: Karur stampede: Special teams formed to arrest TVK’s Anand, CTR; anticipatory bail plea filed
content: Three special teams have been formed to arrest TVK general secretary Bussy Anand and deputy general secretary CTR Nirmal Kumar following a stampede at a rally that killed 41. Police accuse them of mismanagement and deliberate delays, while the two leaders have sought anticipatory bail from the Madras High Court.

title: 'I Love Mohammad' row: Cong MP Imran Masood put under house arrest
content: Congress MP Imran Masood was placed under house arrest in Saharanpur, preventing his visit to violence-hit Bareilly. Tensions escalated there following protests over an 'I Love Muhammad' poster, leading to stone-pelting and police action. Authorities detained 50 individuals, including cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan, as CM Yogi Adityanath ordered strict measures. Security remains heightened with Section 144 imposed.

title: R Madhavan shares ultimate parting advice to raise disciplined, successful kids
content: Actor R Madhavan reveals parenting advice from his Canadian host mother, back from his college days and one that he still applies on his son, Vedaant. He applies this principle, providing his son Vedaant with purpose and routine to avoid negative influences. This approach, supported by research, suggests structured engagement and meaningful tasks help children thrive and reduce risky behaviour.

title: Teenage sensation! Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes century; record vs Aus U-19
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old prodigy, recently smashed 113 runs in a Youth Test against Australia U-19, following his record-breaking career sixes in Youth ODIs. He previously became the youngest Ranji Trophy debutant and IPL contract earner, where he scored a sensational 38-ball 101. Suryavanshi continues to rewrite cricket's record books across formats.

title: Northern lights and Autumn star shine this week; when and where to see
content: The night sky promises a spectacular week with heightened Northern Lights activity following the fall equinox, offering prime viewing in high-latitude regions like Canada and Scotland. Additionally, the bright 'Autumn Star,' Fomalhaut, will be visible in the southern sky on October 3. Skywatchers should seek clear, dark locations for optimal viewing of these celestial events.

title: 'Will be given to some guy': Trump pushes for Nobel, calls denial of prize an ‘insult'
content: US President Donald Trump stated he deserves the Nobel Peace Prize for resolving seven global conflicts, deeming its absence an "insult" to the nation. He expects to resolve the Israel-Hamas conflict with his 20-point plan, potentially bringing his tally to eight.

title: Stock market holiday: Will NSE, BSE remain closed on October 2?
content: Indian stock markets will remain closed on October 2 for Gandhi Jayanti and Dussehra, with trading resuming Friday. October features 11 market holidays, including key Diwali dates. Ahead of the RBI policy, markets showed recovery in early trade, though the Sensex had dropped 3.30% over the past eight days.

title: Trump admin’s last-ditch effort fails; US govt shuts down – Why it matters
content: The US federal government has shut down, the first in nearly seven years, after Senate Democrats blocked a Republican funding bill. This impasse, driven by deep partisan divisions over spending and healthcare, leaves hundreds of thousands of federal employees furloughed and disrupts many government operations, with significant economic and public impacts.

title: India-US ties: Trump reposts PM Modi's post on Gaza peace plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi endorsed US President Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan, hailing it as a viable path to lasting stability for Palestinian and Israeli people. Trump, alongside Israeli PM Netanyahu, unveiled the initiative, proposing an immediate ceasefire and hostage release.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rises above 24,700; BSE Sensex jumps 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday ahead of the RBI monetary policy. While Nifty50 was above 24,600, BSE Sensex was up over 50 points.

title: Haryana: Class 2 boy hung upside down, thrashed over homework at 'illegal' school; principal held
content: A Sonipat private school principal and driver were arrested for brutally thrashing a Class 2 student, who was strung upside down and beaten for not doing homework. The August 22 incident, revealed by a video, exposed the school's illegal operation, prompting officials to order student relocation and a crackdown on unauthorized institutions.

title: Kelsey Mitchell injury update: Fever guard hit with devastating news
content: Indiana Fever star Kelsey Mitchell suffered a leg injury in Game 5 of the WNBA semifinals against the Las Vegas Aces, exiting the game in the third quarter. This critical blow leaves the already injury-riddled Fever without their leading scorer and MVP finalist, severely impacting their championship aspirations. Her condition and return timeline remain uncertain.

title: H-1B crackdown shakes US workforce: Big tech layoffs hit immigrants; careers at risk
content: In 2025, H-1B visa holders in the US confront unprecedented challenges due to policy shifts like a $100,000 application fee, large-scale tech layoffs creating an oversaturated job market, and eroded healthcare access. This convergence forces skilled professionals to navigate career uncertainty, financial strain, and psychological stress, prompting many to consider international opportunities for stability.

title: Student suicides up 65% in a decade, faster rise than overall suicides: NCRB
content: Student suicides in India have surged by 65% over the past decade, significantly outpacing the national average and raising urgent concerns about mental health. Academic pressure, unemployment fears, and inadequate support systems are key factors. Targeted interventions in educational institutions, along with comprehensive mental health support, are crucial to address this alarming trend.

title: Zubeen Garg death probe: Manager and festival organiser arrested; brought to Guwahati
content: Festival organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta and late singer Zubeen Garg’s manager, Siddhartha Sharma, have been arrested in Delhi and brought to Guwahati. Mahanta was reportedly hiding in Singapore, facing lookout notices. Assam DGP Harmeet Singh confirmed a transparent investigation, with teams deployed and a logical conclusion expected within seven days, urging public trust in the ongoing legal process.

title: Bihar SIR: 6% drop in voters; 3.7 lakh electors declared ‘ineligible’
content: Bihar's final electoral roll for the upcoming assembly elections is 7.4 crore, reflecting a 6% drop from the pre-revision count. This figure follows the Special Intensive Revision, which involved deleting 3.7 lakh ineligible names and adding 21.5 lakh new voters. The process, initially marked by 65 lakh deletions, had previously sparked significant opposition protests.

title: Home season plans: India want flatter pitches vs WI, turners for South Africa
content: It is likely that the team management would want to play on turning pitches when South Africa come to play two Tests in Nov. India had suffered a 0-3 drubbing at the hands of New Zealand at home last year on pitches that turned square from Day One. It cost India a chance to make the World Test Championship (WTC) final for the first time since its inception in 2021.

title: Man loses 110 pounds eating a ‘common sense diet’
content: Nick Geoppo, who lost 110 pounds and kept it off for six years, reveals the weight loss industry's unsustainable cycle. He advocates aiming to conquer obesity permanently, not just lose weight, through a 'common sense diet.' What is a common sense diet? Well it as interesting as it sounds. The man claims its sustainable and helped him in his journey. "Your goal is not to lose weight," he said. Read more.

title: Are Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja expecting their second child? Here's what we know
content: Sonam Kapoor, who welcomed her first child Vayu in August 2022, is reportedly expecting her second baby. Sources indicate the actress is in her second trimester, with an official announcement from the couple anticipated soon. Sonam previously shared how motherhood has made her softer yet more resilient. Her father, Anil Kapoor, is also reportedly 'obsessed' with grandson Vayu.

title: Mid-air clash: UP MLA pushed by passenger on Air India flight; flyer booked
content: A 26-year-old passenger, Samad Ali, was booked by Sarojininagar police following a mid-air altercation with Gauriganj MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh aboard an Air India flight from Delhi to Lucknow. Singh alleged Ali used abusive language on the phone, and when confronted, Ali reportedly argued with and pushed the MLA.

title: Asia Cup fallout: Mohsin Naqvi humiliated in front of ACC officials; BCCI lashes out
content: BCCI strongly objected to ACC President Mohsin Naqvi taking the Asia Cup trophy and medals after India's win. At the ACC AGM, BCCI representatives cornered Naqvi, refusing his offer for Suryakumar Yadav to collect them due to Naqvi's anti-India posts. The issue is now deferred for mediation, with India threatening an ICC complaint.

title: Ravens’ season collapsing as Lamar Jackson’s Super Bowl window slams shut
content: The Baltimore Ravens face turmoil after a 1–3 start, with ESPN's Chris Canty declaring their season "a wrap" following a lopsided loss to the Chiefs. Concerns over Lamar Jackson’s injury and mounting roster issues fuel doubts about their Super Bowl chances. While some argue it's too early to write them off, the team is under immense pressure to recover.

title: Philippines earthquake: Powerful quake kills 60; epicentre at depth of 5 kilometers
content: A powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines, claiming at least 69 lives and causing extensive damage across Cebu province. The quake, centered near Bogo, led to widespread power outages and collapsed structures, with death tolls rising in towns like Bogo, Medellin, and San Remigio.

title: LPG price hike: Commercial cylinder cost up by Rs 15.50
content: Oil marketing companies have increased the price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders by Rs 15.50, setting the new Delhi rate at Rs 1,595.50. Domestic LPG cylinder prices remain unchanged. These routine adjustments reflect global LPG rates and distribution costs, while petrol and diesel prices have been stable since last March.

title: Unbelievable! Shubman Gill's Test redemption: Three phone calls, ego & data
content: Three phone calls changed Shubman Gill’s destiny — one from Steven Smith, another from Kane Williamson, and the most defining, from Sachin Tendulkar. It was the God of cricket’s stern advice that forced Gill to shed his ego, tweak his technique, and script one of the greatest batting series ever by an Indian captain in England

title: 'Dubai sheikh wants sexual partner': Chaitanyananda's disturbing messages
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati, a former management institute director, faces multiple allegations of sexual harassment and fraud. He reportedly attempted to arrange a sexual partner for a "Dubai Sheikh" and sent obsessive, infantilising messages to victims. Police are investigating these chats as part of a broader inquiry into his alleged predatory behaviour at a private institute.

title: 'Kantara Chapter 1': Has the Rishab Shetty film impressed audiences?
content: Rishab Shetty’s highly anticipated 'Kantara: A Legend – Chapter 1' is gearing up for a grand worldwide release on October 2, 2025. Early premiere reviews present a mixed picture; while some laud its grandeur, technical prowess, and intense performances, critic Umair Sandhu deemed it "Overrated & Weird." Despite the varied initial feedback, the prequel has already shattered advance booking records, selling over 1.7 lakh tickets worth Rs 5.7 crore.

title: 'No fault on my part': Vijay targets Stalin over stampede; reveals why he hasn't met victims
content: TVK president Vijay broke his silence on the Karur stampede, denying fault and questioning why the tragedy occurred only there. He urged CM Stalin to target him instead of his supporters, expressing deep grief over the incident. Vijay vowed to meet victims soon and continue TVK's political journey with renewed strength.

title: Hyderabad Cop's Family Beats Up Woman After Their Dog Pees Outside Her House
content: A 60-year-old woman was brutally assaulted by a police constable's wife and sister in the Telangana's Madannapet, allegedly over a dispute about the constable's dog urinating near her house.

title: "How Much Can I Give You To Make You Stop?" US Woman Raped By Homeless Man
content: A 36-year-old woman was allegedly raped by a homeless man inside her apartment in Norwood, New York City. The incident happened at around 5 am when she was approached by a 21-year-old man inside a residential building on East Gun Hill Road

title: 1 Case In 2022, 3,399 In '23: Manipur's Big Spike In Crimes Against Tribals
content: India witnessed a sharp 28.7 per cent rise in crimes against members of the Scheduled Tribes (ST) community in 2023, with the northeastern state of Manipur emerging as the most affected, according to the latest data released by NCRB

title: RBI Raises IPO Loan Limit To Rs 25 Lakh, Eases Lending Rules For Banks
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday announced a major set of changes to make bank credit more accessible for companies and individuals.

title: 'Helped Nurture Countless Lives': PM Modi Praises RSS At Centenary Celebrations
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday praised the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) for its long-standing commitment to nation-building. He said the RSS has helped nurture and strengthen countless lives over the years.

title: Death Count In Massive Philippines Earthquake Rises To 69, Over 100 Injured
content: The death toll from a powerful earthquake in the central Philippines rose to at least 69 on Wednesday, a disaster official said, with scores of injured patients overwhelming hospitals on the island of Cebu.

title: "RSS Is Where Journey From 'I' To 'We' Begins": PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated on Wednesday that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is an organisation focused on character development to aid in nation building, inspiring individuals to transition from 'I' to 'We'.

title: How US Government Shutdown Will Affect Education Department's Work
content: Already diminished by cuts by the Trump administration, the US Education Department will see more of its work come to a halt due to the government shutdown.

title: Delhi Man Refuses To Pay For Food, Delivery Partner Calls Cops, This Happens
content: A drunk teacher in Delhi's Narela refused to pay for a food delivery, but ended up paying a much heavier price. Refused payment, the delivery partner called the cops.

title: "Most Beautiful": Trump Says Asim Munir Praised Him For India-Pakistan Truce
content: US President Donald Trump doubled down on his claim of brokering a truce between India and Pakistan during military conflict earlier this year.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi Asked What He Would've Done As PM After Pahalgam Terror Attack. His Response
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday brushed off a question about a hypothetical situation where he was the Prime Minister during the Pahalgam terror attack, saying he only "deals with reality".

title: Eggs Thrown During Garba Event In Thane Housing Society, Case Filed
content: A Garba celebration at the housing society in Thane was disrupted when eggs were allegedly thrown from an upper floor by a person, sparking anger among residents, police said on Wednesday.

title: Navi Mumbai International Airport A Monument Shaped By Thousands: Gautam Adani
content: The Navi Mumbai International Airport, set to open next week, is a monument shaped by thousands of hands and hearts, said Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group, on Wednesday.

title: Donald Trump Reposts PM Modi's Message Endorsing His Gaza Plan
content: US President Donald Trump has reshared Prime Minister Narendra Modi's message extending support to his new plan to end the Gaza conflict.

title: Delhi Police Arrest Robbery Accused After 12-Year Manhunt
content: In a major breakthrough, the Crime Branch of Delhi Police has apprehended a man who had been on the run for 12 years in connection with a violent daylight robbery in Kirti Nagar in 2013.

title: Husband Can't Claim Sole Right To Joint Property Just Because He Paid EMIs: Delhi High Court
content: The couple got married in 1999 and jointly purchased a house in 2005 in Mumbai. However, they began living separately in 2006.

title: 'Law Will Take Its Course': Zubeen Garg's Wife To NDTV After His Manager's Arrest
content: Garima Garg, the wife of Assam's icon and renowned singer Zubeen Garg, said the "law will take its own course" - hours after two arrests were made in her husband's death case.

title: US Government Shuts Down, 1st Since 2018: What Remains Functional, Closed
content: The US government has officially shut down after Democrats blocked a Republican stopgap funding package that didn't address their demands.

title: Ex-Astronomer CEO, Wife Spotted Together Months After Coldplay Fiasco: Report
content: Two months after Andy Bryon, the former CEO of Astronomer, was caught on camera with company HR chief Kristin Cabot during a Coldplay concert, there's a twist to the tale.

title: How An Elephant Theft Complaint Led Jharkhand Cops To Unveil Bizarre Case
content: An elephant never forgets, but this is the story of an elephant who won't be forgotten. Jayamati, a female elephant, is at the centre of a bizarre tale spanning three states -- Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand and Bihar

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Springer's Hartford Whalers batting gloves to be donated to Hockey Hall of Fame
content: springer's batting gloves will go to the hockey hall of fame in Toronto . the 36-year-old outfielder is a native of new Britain, Connecticut . springer is entering the postseason on the back of a resurgent 2025 campaign .

title: Tyreek Hill injury FAQ: Recovery timetable, his NFL future and how Dolphins will adapt
content: Tyreek Hill likely to miss at least the remainder of the 2025 regular season . it's a massive blow to a team that picked up its first win of the season but now must claw back from a 1-3 record without a player who has been the NFL's preeminent home run threat for the past decade . "Next man up," running back de'Von Achane says of losing Hill after Monday's game .

title: Who will make the 12-team College Football Playoff?
content: Content extraction failed.

title: 17 new coordinators: Who’s passing the grade so far and who’s struggling
content: Corey Hetherman is a respected coordinator from Minnesota . hetherman, Gus Malzahn and Tony White are among those hired . the team is ninth nationally in points allowed (11.5 PPG) and tied for eighth against the run .

title: Ranking winners and losers, injury impacts from Sunday
content: RB, Las Vegas Raiders : Ashton Jeanty led all running backs through the late window on Sunday . he rushed for 138 yards and a touchdown on 21 carries, plus he added two receptions for 17 yards . the rookie could see a bump in pass game usage after his production .

title: Pereira was on the wrong side of UFC title history once; will that happen again?
content: ankalaev-Pereira 2 will be the first bout for both fighters since the belt changed hands . pereira dethroned pereira when they met in march . he will be aiming to regain the light heavyweight title on saturday .

title: Tracking MLB offseason manager changes: Giants dismissed Bob Melvin, who else is out?
content: the first managerial changes of the 2025-26 offseason came on the first day after the season . the San Francisco Giants dismissed Bob Melvin, the Minnesota Twins fired Rocco Baldelli, and the Texas Rangers announced that Bruce Bochy will not return . ESPN will track all of the managerial hirings and firings and provide potential top replacements for every opening .

title: Goalie guide: The goaltending timeshares to target
content: from 2009-10 to 2016-17, the average crease share of a top-12 fantasy goalie was 74.1%, with an average of 35.2 wins and 215.7 fantasy points . 25% had a goaltender with 75% creaseshare or higher and 54.2% had at least 65% .

title: LeBron's future, Celtics' goals sans Tatum: Biggest question for all 30 teams
content: despite 22 days separating the preseason from opening night, not every team's offseason storylines have been resolved . how will the saga trickle into the Golden State Warriors ' season; how the LA Clippers will handle the league's investigation into Kawhi Leonard . what are the expectations for the Indiana Pacers this season are just some of the largest stories to follow .

title: Doha to open first museum dedicated to M F Husain in November
content: From Neeru Bajwa to Shehnaaz Gill: Leading ladies shaping Punjabi cinema’s bright future In pics: Vijay Sethupathi’s fierce avatar in Bigg Boss Tamil 9 promo 10 small dog breeds perfect for apartment living: Family-friendly and easy to care for Disha Parmar approved top 10 stylish looks Navratri 2025: Shraddha Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and other divas' inspired pink ethnic looks for day 9 From Chic to Classy: Priyanka Mohan’s style evolution Mamitha Baiju mesmerizes; nature meets grace Monalisa stuns in red saree for Durga Puja Best family games that will make your kids forget all about screens Karthika Nair shines bright captivating hearts with beauty and poise

title: Police detain Congress MP, SP MLA at house to prevent from visiting Bareilly
content: The two leaders were scheduled to travel to the city by an early morning train to meet some police officers, but were confined to their residences

title: Arunachal Pradesh Congress demands apology from BJP over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
content: "This is not just an irresponsible remark, but a criminal act of intimidation," APCC president Bosiram Siram said

title: How to attract birds, butterflies and other beings? - Experts suggest measures as HYDRAA rejuvenates Hyderabad’s lakes
content: People working towards documenting and restoration of biodiversity, urged authorities undertaking lake rejuvenation to take proactive measures to restore biodiversity

title: India wasted opportunity to give befitting reply to Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack: Owaisi
content: Asaduddin Owaisi says an atmosphere of war had prevailed as drones launched by Pakistan hovered over the western borders from Gujarat to Kashmir

title: PM Modi's silence on atrocities in Gaza 'total betrayal' of what India has stood for: Congress
content: "Where is the accountability for the genocide that has been carried out in Gaza over the past twenty months?" Jairam Ramesh said

title: Odisha districts on alert as IMD forecasts heavy rain owing to low pressure over Bay of Bengal
content: Fishermen have been advised not to venture into the sea along and off the Odisha coast during October 1 to October 4

title: Contractor booked in building collapse incident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin expressed grief over the incident; the nine victims hail from Assam

title: Major General G. Srinivas, who oversaw logistics in Operation Sindoor, takes charge as CDM Commandant
content: Before his appointment, Major General Srinivas was entrusted with the planning and execution of operational logistics in the Western Command theatre, including during the recent Operation Sindoor

title: Mid-air scuffle with Uttar Pradesh MLA lands passenger in police custody
content: The incident happened on Air India flight when MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh objected to a passenger, Samad Ali, allegedly using foul language while talking on the phone

title: Police close probe into stone attack on Anil Deshmukh; leader alleges pressure
content: The former Maharashtra Home Minister claimed the police were under pressure and the incident was being given a political colour

title: Zubeen Garg’s manager, Singapore festival organiser arrested from NCR, remanded to 14 days’ police custody
content: The two were flown to Guwahati and taken to the residence of the chief judicial magistrate concerned, as the courts are closed due to the Durga Puja holiday

title: Conflict-hit Manipur logged over 6,200 arson cases in 2023, 45% of India’s total
content: The sharp rise in arson cases in 2023 aligns with the widespread destruction recorded during the ethnic conflict that year in the State

title: Charge sheet filed against rapper Vedan and others for ‘ganja’ consumption
content: The accused have been charged under the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act and they were let off on bail after their arrest

title: RSS general secretary hails “unwavering” public support for the Sangh through its 100-year journey
content: The Sangh consistently sought consensus on matters of Hindu unity, national security, social harmony, democracy, and preservation of culture, says Mr. Hosabale, adding that acceptance grew steadily over time

title: Speculating on ‘Kathipara’
content: ‘The entire area has a lot of streets that have Army connotations — Lashkarkhana (a camp), Asarghana (Afsar Khana or Officer’s Enclave), Butt Road (there was a rifle practice butt here), Magazine Road, North Parade, etc.’

title: When 50 people died in two Sunday stampedes in Chennai
content: The deaths of 50 people in two stampedes, both of which occurred on Sundays, in Chennai, 20 years ago, would illustrate how lessons in crowd management are rarely learned

title: Two police constables arrested for raping young woman in Tiruvannamalai
content: The 19-year-old survivor, who hails from Andhra Pradesh, was picked up by the duo after stopping the truck she was travelling in for checking documents

title: When an industrialist’s saree giveaway at Palani ended in stampede on Gandhi Jayanthi
content: Late at night in 1993 chaos broke out with everyone in the crowd wanting to grab the sarees. In the melee many elderly women fell down leading to a stampede that killed 12 women

title: Punjab seeks special package for flood damages; Centre says it stands shoulder to shoulder with people of Punjab
content: The relief of ₹1,600 crore announced by the Centre is miniscule in the wake of the grave loss suffered by Punjab, says CM Mann

title: Commission for quacks: How private hospitals in Telangana profit from unqualified practitioners
content: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
content: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

title: RSS should continue to focus on nation-building for next 100 years, says former Congress MP Karan Singh
content: Though Mr. Singh’s stance is at odds with the Congress’s official position on the RSS, the party has not issued any statement or clarification

title: Over 60 lakh hectares of farms hit by rains, have sought relief from Centre, says CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM seeks relief package for flood-affected farmland, rejects “wet drought” term, promises aid before Deepavali

title: Karur stampede: What triggered the chaos
content: The stampede at an overcrowded roadshow held by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder and actor Vijay occurred due to poor planning and leadership

title: MPC meet: RBI keeps repo rate steady at 5.5%; warns of growth risks from US tariffs
content: best family games that will make your kids forget all about screens Karthika Nair shines bright captivating hearts with beauty and poise Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments .

title: 'Example of sacrifice, selfless service': PM Modi hails RSS' 100-year journey
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap’s death
content: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

title: Wangchuk served NSA detention order: Ladakh administration
content: It accused the climate activist of suggesting “self-immolation” to people of Ladakh on “multiple occasions” on “lines of protests in Tibet”

title: Telangana logged 10,580 suicides in 2023, says NCRB
content: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State’s total cases

title: Civil society groups, activists demand Wangchuk’s release
content: Addressing a press conference, Gitanjali Angmo, Mr. Wangchuk’s wife, said she had not been able to contact her husband, nor had the police provided her a copy of the NSA order yet.

title: Tamil Nadu seeks review of Supreme Court judgment directing teachers to qualify for TET or quit service
content: If the directions are implemented, the entire school system faces the imminent prospect of collapse, with mass disqualification of teachers and denial of classroom instruction to millions of children. This creates a direct conflict with Article 21A of the Constitution, which guarantees the fundamental right to education, Tamil Nadu argues in Supreme Court

title: Lorry topples on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: Police said the lorry was proceeding towards Koyambedu Wholesale market in Chennai from Bengaluru to deliver a consignment of onions when the driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka report most number of farmer suicides
content: Removing import restrictions, succumbing to ‘tariff terrorism’ will worsen the situation, warns Kisan Sabha

title: Bihar had just five Passport and Foreigners Act cases in 2023: NCRB report
content: Illegal migration and infiltration have been raised as key issues ahead of the Bihar polls; according to NCRB data, in 2023, most of the cases pertaining to laws governing foreigners were registered in Bengal, followed by Tripura, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Punjab

title: BJP moves to consolidate votes in Bihar, to pull out Madhya Pradesh playbook
content: Bhojpuri singer Pawan Singh, whose independent candidacy led to NDA’s defeat in Karakat in 2024 Lok Sabha elections, has been pulled back into the party fold. The party is also planning to field many senior leaders, including Union Ministers, in the Assembly polls as it did in Madhya Pradesh

title: U.P. PGT exam postponed again; aspirants, Opposition slam government’s repeated delays
content: Students allege that this is the fifth time the examination, whose notification was released in April 2022, has been postponed, citing unavoidable reasons

title: Karnataka tops civic negligence deaths, says NCRB data
content: Civic negligence in Karnataka leads to 23 deaths in 2023, highlighting systemic issues and lack of accountability

title: Indian Railways to launch first assured-transit container train from Delhi to Kolkata in October
content: The bi-weekly service will run from Inland Container Depot (ICD) Tughlakabad in Delhi, to CONCOR’s CTCS terminal in Kolkata via Agra and Kanpur.

title: CM says some journalists are acting as a catspaw of their corporate owners
content: Corporate-controlled media is pursuing an aggressive news agenda that sought to divide the country along religious lines to obfuscate the livelihood issues plaguing the people

title: Over 3,000 students in Tirupattur mourn Karur stampede
content: According to a press release, students also took a pledge for their commitment to safety and observed a moment of silence in a tribute to the departed

title: U.P. Police initiate demolition action against properties linked to Bareilly cleric’s aide
content: 16 rioters who attacked the police in Bareilly with bricks, stones, and bottles of acid were arrested by the police

title: Bridging the fighter jet gap is top priority: IAF Deputy Chief
content: We are looking at the LCA Mk2 and have also invested in the Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft, which represents the future of indigenous combat platforms. However, these projects will take time to mature. In the immediate future, we need to bridge the capability gap

title: Kerala Govt. receives nearly 18,000 petitions during human-wildlife conflict mitigation programme
content: Second phase of programme will commence on October 1. Over the next four days, the complaints will be categorised, following which district-level meetings, chaired by the Minister in-charge of districts, will be held

title: FIR filed against Maharashtra Congress over social media post
content: Mumbai Police registers FIR against unidentified person for allegedly inciting violence through social media post showing BJP office on fire amidst protests

title: After controversy, CJI Bhushan Gavai’s mother undecided on being chief guest at RSS event
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh had extended an invite to Kamala Gavai for its Vijayadasami celebration which will be held in Amravati on October 5

title: India got 8% more monsoon rain this year
content: While northern India saw extremely heavy spells, causing loss of life and property, east and northeast regions got lesser rain than usual

title: KBR National Park being turned into a walkers’ park, allege nature lovers
content: Designed to be a forested sanctuary in centre of Hyderabad, it is witnessing construction and landscaping more suited to an urban recreation space with rows of cement blocks, hedge plantations, gazebos coming up inside the park; naturalists allege biodiversity erosion and disturbance to wildlife

title: Bengaluru reported more dowry cases than combined total of 18 other metro cities in 2023
content: In 2023, Bengaluru recorded 1,013 dowry cases, the highest in the country, followed by Patna (104) and Lucknow (19).

title: Nine migrant workers killed, one injured in construction site accident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: The workers, all from Assam, were working at a height of over 20 feet when the iron scaffolding installed for the construction of an arch collapsed; Kattur police file case, begin probe into incident

title: Heavy rush continues on ninth day of Dasara at Indrakeeladri
content: Kanaka Durga temple sees thousands of devotees flocking for darshan of the goddess in the special Durga Ashtami alankaram, while authorities ensure smooth access, prasadam distribution, and facilities for the elderly and differently-abled.

title: IMD forecasts above normal Northeast monsoon in most parts of Tamil Nadu
content: RMC officials say a low-pressure area is likely to form today and intensify into a depression; it will cross south Odisha-north Andhra Pradesh coasts on October 3; parts of T.N. may also get rain as the system moves closer

title: Splendour marks ‘Surya Prabha Vahana’ seva in Tirumala
content: The processional deity of Lord Malayappa, dressed in the attire of Lord Badrinarayana, has been taken out in a grand procession, providing a visual feast to the scores of devotees

title: Bengaluru accounts for over 51% of all cybercrimes in metro cities in 2023: NCRB data
content: Among metropolitan cities, Bengaluru reported the highest number of cybercrime cases, contributing 51.92% of all cases across the 19 metros

title: Child marriage: Members of mosque committee booked in Bengaluru
content: The incident came to light when a city-based advocate, Hussain Owais S., lodged a complaint with the State and city police chiefs and the Child Welfare Committee about the marriage of a 16-year-old girl to a 20-year-old boy.

title: Boom-and-bust cycles of sardine linked to monsoon and oceanographic changes, says CMFRI study
content: The study by CMFRI integrated fisheries biology and oceanographic data from Kochi, Vizhinjam, and Kozhikode

title: Kerala leads in chargesheeting rate but records alarming rise in suicides
content: According to data from National Crime Records Bureau for 2023,  Kerala  has reported the highest chargesheeting rate under Indian Penal Code crimes at 95.6%
